programs.title: AI Agents Fundamentals and AI Agent Building Hands on
programs.about: This intensive program focuses on the technical foundations of Autonomous AI Agents. Students will learn how to build, orchestrate, and deploy multi-agent systems that can plan, reason, and execute complex tasks.

schedule.description: Understanding LLMs as reasoning engines, Agentic vs Non-agentic workflows.
Chain-of-Thought, ReAct pattern, and few-shot prompting for reliable agent behavior.
Introduction to LangGraph and LangChain for structured agent design.
Mastering CrewAI for multi-agent role-playing and task delegation.
Connecting agents to external tools (Search, Database, Python) and private knowledge bases.
Implementing short-term and long-term memory for persistence across turns.
Hierarchical vs Sequential workflows; supervisor agent patterns.
Ensuring safety in autonomous systems using NeMo Guardrails or Llama Guard.
Serving agentic workflows via LangServe and containerized environments.
Presentation of a fully functional autonomous agent solving a real-world problem.

outcomes: Build autonomous agents that can use external tools effectively.
Orchestrate multi-agent teams using CrewAI and LangGraph.
Implement robust state management and memory for AI systems.
Deploy agentic services in production-ready environments.
Understand the ethical and security guardrails required for autonomous AI.

programs.client: Vels Institute of Science, Technology & Advanced Studies (VISTAS)
programs.title: Deployment of AI Applications for Cloud and Mobile Platforms
programs.about: This 10-day intensive training program is designed to equip students with the skills required to take AI models from a local development environment to a global scale.

schedule.description: Overview of AI lifecycles, introduction to major cloud providers, and setting up the environment.
Understanding containerization and writing Dockerfiles for AI models.
CI/CD pipelines for automated deployment and registry management.
Creating RESTful and GraphQL APIs using Flask or FastAPI.
Designing scalable architectures connecting backends with mobile thin-clients.
Strategies for reducing cloud compute costs and optimizing model latency.
Deep dive into real-world applications: Computer Vision and NLP for chatbots.
Exploring TFLite, CoreML, and ONNX for running models directly on mobile devices.
Hands-on project work implementing a full-stack AI application.
Project presentations, final feedback, and certification roadmap.

outcomes: Deploy machine learning models securely on cloud platforms.
Write production-grade containers for AI workloads.
Design and implement API-driven mobile AI architectures.
Optimize AI applications for both cost and performance.
Deliver a full-stack Capstone Project.

programs.title: Advanced AI-Powered Java Development using GitHub Copilot
programs.about: This training is designed for mid-level and senior Java backend engineers to use GitHub Copilot as an engineering accelerator and build AI-enabled Java systems.

schedule.topic: Foundations of AI & LLMs for Java Developers
schedule.description: Understanding foundational models and LLM integration in Java ecosystems.
Learning Retrieval Augmented Generation patterns specifically for Java applications.
Implementing complex vector search and context-rich retrieval in enterprise Java.
Using Copilot for boilerplate reduction, testing, and legacy code migration.
Advanced prompt engineering for internal tool building and workflow automation.
Using libraries like LangChain4j and Spring AI to embed models into services.
System design for scalable, reliable AI features in large-scale Java systems.
Automating AI evaluations and CI/CD for AI-integrated Java apps.
Building and deploying autonomous Java-based agents for internal ops.
Exploring Model Context Protocol (MCP) and final project discussions.

outcomes: 2x-4x faster development cycles using AI acceleration.
Reduced debugging and refactoring effort systematically.
Cleaner, more maintainable Java codebases using AI patterns.
Ability to design and build AI-enabled Java systems including RAG.
Expertise in using GitHub Copilot for complex architectural tasks.

programs.title: End-to-End Multi-Agent Systems Development
programs.about: This immersive program guides students through the entire lifecycle of building a robust, full end-to-end multi-agent system, from architecture to cloud deployment.

schedule.description: Intro to Multi-Agent Systems, Roles, Communication, Hierarchy, and Development Setup.
Building RESTful APIs with FastAPI/Express and Implementing 'Agent-as-a-Service'.
Integrating memory, custom tools, and handling asynchronous agent tasks.
Modern React development and implementing WebSockets for live agent streaming.
Setting up CI/CD pipelines and deploying to cloud platforms like Vercel.

outcomes: A fully functional, multi-agent application hosted live in the cloud.
Full-Stack competency in Python/Node.js, APIs, and React.
Deep understanding of multi-agent design patterns and tooling.
Practical experience in Git-based collaboration and CI/CD.
Mastery of real-time UI interactions for AI applications.
